TopicTitle: Found a cool gem: Atmospheric docking

Articles.Content:
I just found something really amazing.

I don't know if this is the correct forum section. A Mod may move this if not.

This guy is docking a segmented airplane made of 4 parts together in Kerbin atmoshpere in mid-flight.

Never seen such a thing before and wanted to share this with you guys.

Edited September 12, 2015 by Cairol

What would really impress me is doing that during a re-entry - that would add the Ironman 'falling to my dooooom' excitement!

Still, pretty awesome

Awesome.

not as awesome as someone catching a drunken guy who jumped out of a plane without a parachute (youtube it!), but still awesome.

I just found something really amazing.

I don't know if this is the correct forum section. A Mod may move this if not.

This guy is docking a segmented airplane made of 4 parts together in Kerbin atmoshpere in mid-flight.

Never seen such a thing before and wanted to share this with you guys.

You also need to remember this was two control sets to be able to put this off, he was controlling both plane parts at the same with the main part he is trying to dock with he is using a joystick and another screen, while the part you see on youtube is done via another set of controls and another screen, so unless you have this setup, you may wanna skip this challenge.
